area.key: The umb-editor-footer element (outlined in red) is used as a container to display a footer on the current editor screen in Umbraco. It contains a left (outlined in blue) and right element (outlined in green). For example, these are used in Umbraco to display a breadcrumb and the save/publish buttons while editing content.

The umbEditorHeader directive is used to display the header if things like DocumentTypes, MemberTypes and so on are edited. It has input boxes for icon, name, description and alias.

Directive attributes:

  • name
  • nameLocked
  • nameRequired
  • menu
  • hideActionsMenu
  • icon
  • hideIcon
  • alias
  • aliasLocked
  • hideAlias
  • description
  • hideDescription
  • descriptionLocked
  • navigation
  • onSelectNavigationItem
  • key
  • onBack
  • showBackButton
  • editorfor
  • setpagetitle
